info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 04 at 6:24PM EST until February 05 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River Near Fletcher affecting Buncombe and Henderson Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...French Broad River Near Fletcher. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Action Stage Flooding continues. Butler Bridge Rd. is inundated with up to 6 inches of floodwaters from the French Broad River, forcing road closure. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:46 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 6.3 feet Wednesday morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement should be issued Saturday morning before 700 AM EST.
